name: MRI Lumbar Spine w/o Dye
description: Magnetic resonance imaging of the lower back without contrast
insights: MRI prices can vary by 300-500% between hospitals in the same area.
Outpatient imaging centers typically charge 40-60% less than hospital-based facilities.
Cash prices are often lower than insurance rates if you haven't met your deductible.
Ask about "self-pay" discounts - many facilities offer 20-40% off for upfront payment.

name: MRI Brain w/ & w/o Dye
description: Magnetic resonance imaging of the brain with and without contrast
insights: Brain MRIs with contrast typically cost 20-30% more than without contrast.
The contrast dye (gadolinium) adds $100-300 to the total cost.
Some insurance plans require prior authorization for brain MRIs.
Freestanding imaging centers often have shorter wait times and lower prices.

name: Chest X-Ray 2 Views
description: X-ray examination of the chest, frontal and lateral views
insights: Chest X-rays are one of the most affordable imaging tests available.
Urgent care centers often offer competitive pricing for routine X-rays.
Prices can double at hospital emergency departments vs. outpatient facilities.
Most insurance plans cover chest X-rays with minimal or no copay.

name: Comprehensive Metabolic Panel
description: Blood test measuring glucose, calcium, proteins, and electrolytes
insights: Lab test prices vary dramatically - the same test can cost $20 or $200.
Direct-to-consumer lab services often offer the lowest cash prices.
Hospital labs typically charge 3-5x more than independent labs.
Many pharmacies now offer basic blood panels at competitive rates.

name: Complete Blood Count (CBC)
description: Blood test measuring red cells, white cells, and platelets
insights: CBC is one of the most common and affordable blood tests.
Results are usually available within 24 hours.
Independent labs like Quest or LabCorp often have the best cash prices.
Some primary care offices include CBC in annual wellness visits at no extra cost.

name: MRI Knee w/o Dye
description: Magnetic resonance imaging of the knee without contrast
insights: Knee MRIs are among the most commonly ordered orthopedic imaging studies.
Open MRI machines may cost less but provide lower image quality.
Some insurers require trying physical therapy before approving knee MRIs.
Athletic and sports medicine clinics may offer package deals for knee imaging.

name: Upper GI Endoscopy w/ Biopsy
description: Examination of the upper digestive tract with tissue sample
insights: Endoscopy costs include facility fee, physician fee, and anesthesia separately.
Ambulatory surgery centers typically charge 40-50% less than hospitals.
Biopsy pathology fees are often billed separately and can add $200-500.
Some GI practices offer bundled pricing that includes all fees upfront.

name: Knee Arthroscopy
description: Minimally invasive surgery to examine or treat knee joint
insights: Arthroscopy costs can range from $5,000 to $15,000+ depending on location.
Outpatient surgery centers offer significant savings over hospital ORs.
Physical therapy costs post-surgery should be factored into total expense.
Some surgeons offer cash-pay packages that bundle all related fees.
